opendial.bn.distribs

Class MarginalDistribution

  • java.lang.Object
    • opendial.bn.distribs.MarginalDistribution
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ProbDistribution

    public class MarginalDistribution
extends java.lang.Object
implements ProbDistribution
    Representation of a probability distribution P(X|Y1,...Yn) by way of two distributions:
    • a distribution P(X|Y1,...Yn, Z1,...Zm)
    • a distribution P(Z1,...Zm)
    The probability P(X|Y1,...Yn) can be straightforwardly calculated by marginalising out the variables Z1,...Zm.
    Version:
    $Date:: 2014-11-02 15:56:09 #$ *
    Author:
    Pierre Lison (plison@ifi.uio.no)

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static Logger log 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MarginalDistribution(ProbDistribution condDistrib, Assignment assign)
      Creates a new marginal distribution given the first distributions and the value assignment (corresponding to a distribution P(Z1,...Zm) where the provided assignment has a probability 1.0).
      MarginalDistribution(ProbDistribution condDistrib, CategoricalTable uncondDistrib)
      Creates a new marginal distribution given the first distribution and the categorical table P(Z).
      MarginalDistribution(ProbDistribution condDistrib, MultivariateDistribution uncondDistrib)
      Creates a new marginal distribution given the two component distributions.

      Returns the probability P(X=head|condition)
      CategoricalTable getProbDistrib(Assignment condition)
      Returns the categorical table P(X) given the conditional assignment for the variables Y1,...Yn.
      java.util.Set<Value> getValues(ValueRange range)
      Returns the possible values for X given the range of possible conditional values for Y1,...Yn.
      java.lang.String getVariable()
      Returns the variable X.
      boolean isWellFormed()
      Returns true if the two component distributions are well-formed.

      Prune the values below a certain threshold.

      Returns a sample value for the variable X given the conditional assignment
